question: Question_06_(a)
sols:
We have

\[A - \lambda I = \left(\begin{array}{cc}
3 - \lambda & 1 \\ -4 & -1 - \lambda
\end{array}\right)\]

which has determinant

\[\displaystyle{}(3 - \lambda)(-1 - \lambda) - (-4)(1) = \lambda^2 - 2 \lambda + 1.\]

Setting $\lambda^2 - 2 \lambda + 1 = 0$ we find $\lambda = 1$ as the
only eigenvalue.
hints:
To find the eigenvalues of a matrix $M$, we require
$\det(M - \lambda I) = 0$.
